args: C'mon, you gotta be kiddin' me!\nHe's for real attacking us!
Jupiter, stop! Why are you doing this?!
Do you remember what you said when\nwe first met? Before we made our pact?
How can that have anything to do with\nattacking us in the here and now?!
Ha! I guess you'll just have to noodle\nover that one yourself.
This guy ain't messin' around, boss.
If we let things get too spicy, it's gonna\nblow back on the town and the people.\nI'm thinkin' we oughta back off.
Good call, Ranzal. Let's withdraw for now\nand regroup.
I thank you for your aid, Lightwyrm.\nBut you are comfortable with your choice?
Are you feeling pangs of guilt over my\nhaving attacked them?
If you care not, then I will let it go.
Well, just so you aren't laboring under any\nmisunderstandings, it wasn't my express\nintent to be on the side of people.
I may have taken on human form, but I\nnever meant to ingratiate myself to them.\nIt was really more of a lark.
Oh? From my point of view, it's a\nsimple and clear course of action.
Help! Heeelp! The imperial army\nis invading the town!

The Empire is here to invade, you say?
They must have thought to seize the
chance when they saw the prince
and his allies withdraw.
This is a strong point geographically,\nso I imagine they want to secure it for\nthe strategic value.
In other words, new humans have come\nhere to raise further havoc. Idiocy!
You there! Human! I have a question.
You're that violent dragon from before!\nEeek! Stay away!
Answer this question, and be concise:\nWhere are the people that seek to\ninvade this place?
Huh? Well, um, I think they set up\ncamp to the east of town.

Now that the meddlesome prince and
his band have retreated, this is a prime
opportunity for us to take control of the
city! All troops, forwaaard!
A dragon?! How is there a dragon here?!\nThe prince was said to have withdrawn!
What are we going to do, sir?!
Keep your wits about you; one dragon is no\nmatch for us. Now surround it and attack!
Damn it, what's with the dawdling?!\nI told you to attack, so ATTACK ALREADY!
So you're going to remain safe in the back\nwhile everyone else does the dirty work?\nI'm almost impressed.
Th-they got the captain! We're done for!\nRetreat! Retreeeat!
While I loathe humans, I do not believe\nthey should be exterminated wholesale.
Hmm? Ah. A little human from the town.
Yeah! I saw you flying to those imperial\nsoldiers, and I worried over what you\ngoing to do...
But you protected our town! You look scary,\nbut you're actually a really nice dragon.

Yes, well...right. Return to your town and
tell your people to leave this land if they
do not wish to be thrust into unnecessary
conflicts in the future.
Okay, I'll tell 'em all when I get home.\nByeeee! And thank yoooou!
One minute you're attacking the town,\nand the next you're driving off occupiers.\nWhat's your actual goal here, friend?
Too many people had gathered in\nthat town, and thus I attacked it.
Well, it's a hub for trade and traffic in the\nregion, which is why the Empire wants it.
Wait. Are you saying you attacked the\ntown so the residents wouldn't get\nwrapped up in any further conflicts?
Just so. If I destroy the city, the humans\nwill no longer require the area and the\nneed for the conflict will be eliminated.
Humans gather and expand without a care,\nwhich invites unnecessary conflict. Our\nbattle from earlier serves as proof of this.
We can no longer prevent conflict merely\nby laying low those with villainous intent.
To eradicate human conflict, we must cut\noff their interactions and manage them\nwith a much firmer hand.
Is that the answer you've come up with\nover the past three hundred years?
To keep the world righted, we must cull\nand manage the humans so evil does not\nspawn among them.
That is clearly the best method to\neliminate misery in the world,\nand we should act upon it.
Yes, that's right. Join me, Lightwyrm!\nJoin me as we guide the humans\nalong the proper path!
Ah, yes. I think I understand now.\nAnd as such...
